commits.message: fix id of only Movie comes from search

Merge pull request #33 from Ranc58/master

Fix getting movie ID.
commented broken tests, added vcrpy to tests
fix of movie Id search parsing

Merge pull request #27 from avoyageur/person-name-original

fix regex for person.name_original

Merge pull request #26 from maximt/master

person id fix

Merge pull request #25 from maximt/master

fix redirect

Merge pull request #21 from zagaria/feature

Added feature 'Actors' for Movie
fixed error with undefined year of movie
removed Movie, Person, Trailer from module __init__

Merge pull request #13 from mureev/experimental-py3

Update Beautiful Soup up to 4 version support

Merge pull request #10 from swasher/feature

fix movie original title
added API calls to README, fixed class name in parser
added parsing youtube links on trailers page
added protection from not valid trailers
refactored movie, person classes, added set_defaults method, moved series class definitions to movie.py file, removed interfaces get_posts(), get_photos()

Merge pull request #6 from atereshkin/master

Small series page parsing fix

Merge pull request #5 from rembish/rembish-series-tests-fix

Fixing testing for TV series
refactor adding trailers in more clean way
added movie trailers support, fixed search encoding error, added tests

Merge pull request #2 from rembish/bugfixes

bunch of small improvements
fixed getting posters and photos of movie and person
fixed empty values in main page
fixed error with transfering content_name field to kinopoisk page instance
added method for getting person photos
fixed year bug in movie main page parser
fixed cycled dependency error of installing
fixed import requirements and problem with installation via pip
moved all tests to external file, added README, LICENCE, MANIFEST
fixed exception syntax typo, fixed html parsing changes
fixed bug in movie search result parsing
update after changing html of search results 09.12.2010
making igore incorrect symbols while encoding decoding
added support of kinopoisk error 'server unavailable'
fixed bug in layout downloading posters
fixed bugs with bad html layout of kinopoisk
added parsing neccessary elements for main page
refactor url and source scheme, added geting posters
added person and movie and base utils

updated README
```
>>> from kinopoisk.movie import Movie
>>> movie_list = Movie.objects.search('Redacted')
>>> len(movie_list)
1
>>> print movie_list[0].title
Без цензуры
>>> print movie_list[0].id
278229
```

```
In [1]: from kinopoisk.movie import Movie

In [2]: movie_list = Movie.objects.search('The 13th Warrior')

In [3]: len(movie_list)
Out[3]: 11

In [4]: print movie_list[0].title
13-й воин

In [5]: print movie_list[0].title_original
The 13th Warrior
```

> File "<string>", line 17, in <module>

> long_description=open('README.md').read(),

> UnicodeDecodeError: 'charmap' codec can't decode byte 0x98 in position 1086: character maps to <undefined>

Привет,

Может чуть позже займусь написанием новых тестов :) Сейчас я нацелен на
завершение изучение языка и дописывание нужных функций. Вам решить,
принимать коммит или нет.

BTW большую часть нужных изминений я смогу сдлать, но для получения списка
актеров к фильму нужно распарсить другую страницу, а как я поня это
добоавление нового источника. Вот тут я возможно попрошу консультацию, если
вы не против.

Скачал архивом, поправил в 7 строке в install.py на:

Так установилось.
Заработало немного

Теперь при получении данных каждый раз выдает предупреждение

> C:\tools\python\lib\site-packages\beautifulsoup4-4.4.0-py3.4.egg\bs4__init__.py:166: >UserWarning: No parser was explicitly specified, so I'm using the best available HTML parser for >this system ("lxml"). This usually isn't a problem, but if you run this code on another system, or in a >different virtual environment, it may use a different parser and behave differently.
> 
> To get rid of this warning, change this:
> 
> BeautifulSoup([your markup])
> 
> to this:
> 
> BeautifulSoup([your markup], "lxml")

Hi ramusus,

You are welcome!
Sadly, I cannot provide a PR because we are using an outdated version of the API. For some reason the newer version gives us problems (regarding BeautifulSoup). 

A fix for the problem seems to be to increment the check for redirects by 1.(utils.py len(response.history)) It seems that kinopoisk adds an extra redirect causing problems for the API regarding the decision to treat the page as a 'main_page'.

Hi!

The issue is still actual, but it has more to do with the usage of the API
than the API itself.
Overuse of the API seems to anger the source of the metadata.

что я делаю не так?

    m = Movie(id=mov.id)
    m.get_content('main_page')
    print (m.directors)

Сформулирую вопрос получше

from kinopoisk.movie import Movie

m = Movie(id=160977)
m.get_content('main_page')
print (m.title) #вывод: Апокалипсис
print (m.directors) #вывод: []

почему последняя строка ничего не выводит?
Судя по сорцам — это поле ни сейчас, ни в прошлом никогда не заполнялось

Все-равно  id = None.
Например, "Варкрафт".
Т.е. когда поиск находит только один фильм, то сразу показывает страницу фильма, а не список.
Пока борюсь с этим путем добавления к названию фильма текущего года и выполнением повторного запроса.

Вот такой код:
```
from kinopoisk.movie import Movie
movie_list = Movie.objects.search('Варкрафт')
print(movie_list[0].id)
```
